attributes.action: Fund free vet care for people who can't afford it
attributes.background: I feel that hospitals are charging people a lot of money for pet care, some people can't afford. I lost my beloved pet who I consider to be my child because of the high costs of treatment.
attributes.additional_details: My pet was suffering from meningitis.

attributes.action: Make teaching coping mechanisms compulsory in secondary schools
attributes.background: At 8 years-old I lost my mum to cancer, and I'd never dealt with it until 20 years later, because I wasn't equipped with adequate coping mechanisms. Children everywhere are unequipped to deal with trauma they experience on a daily basis, and the stress of later life, I'd like to change that.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 British people suffer from mental health problems, and depression is 10x more widespread than it was just a decade ago (demonstrating its alarming growth under societal changes). 85% of adults experience stress on a regular basis; a cause of anxiety, depression, panic attacks and insomnia. Suicide is the biggest cause of death in men betweeh 20 - 49. And LGBT people are more likely to experience mental health problems, and less likely to have support systems.

attributes.action: Condemn Israeli Army killings of 30 unarmed Palestinian protestors in Gaza
attributes.background: On Friday 30th March this year Palestinians living in the Gaza Strip gathered at various points along the border with Israel to peacefully protest the blockade and demand their right of return to homes that they had been driven out of in 1948 during the Nakba. Now 30 are dead and 1000+ injured.
attributes.additional_details: The 1948 Palestinian exodus, also known as the Nakba, literally "disaster", "catastrophe", or "cataclysm"), occurred when more than 700,000 Palestinian Arabs fled or were expelled from their homes, during the 1948 Palestine war. Between 400 and 600 Palestinian villages were sacked during the war, while urban Palestine was almost entirely extinguished. The term "nakba" also refers to the period of war itself and events affecting Palestinians from December 1947 to January 1949

attributes.action: Stop providers of Buy to Let mortgages discriminating against benefits claimants
attributes.background: The housing crisis in the UK is being exacerbated by the main lenders for Buy to Let mortgages, including TSB, Santander, Virgin and NatWest, stating that landlords must not let their properties to housing benefit claimants. We call on the government to make this discriminatory practice illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 120,000 children are living in temporary homes according to the public accounts committee (01/05/2017 The Times)

The number of tenants in the private sector receiving state help has risen by 50 per cent to almost 1.5 million since the financial crisis as wages stagnate and rents rise (01/05/2017

The combination of economic pressures means more and more vulnerable tenants are being pushed out of the private rented sector (Sean Tompkins, Chief Executive of Rics bbc.co.uk 09/07/2017)

attributes.action: Look at the stats for adopted children failing in education and reasons why
attributes.background: Having been a foster carer, now a parent of two adopted children and working in education, I have decided to speak out for all those families who live with the reality that adoption can bring for their children and education. The statistics for adopted children failing in education are unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Once a child is adopted the trauma some of them have faced does not suddenly disappear and the support they require needs to be accessible for them especially in education and I believe this starts with training for all staff in schools and nurseries. 
Failing in education due to lack of understanding of an adopted childs needs is unacceptable and I want the government to have to answer to why the statistics are so high.

attributes.action: Vote for whether there should be another EU referendum
attributes.background: HM Government says that if there is another referendum, then Democracy is broken. Therefore, I am calling for a vote on whether another referendum should take place, which means Democracy is not broken as the people have chosen to have another referendum if it is voted for.
attributes.additional_details: This means that the government must hold another referendum as the people of the nation voted for it, and must not neglect democracy. Lies were made in the campaign for Brexit, and politicians have not been held accounted for that. I personally believe that false hope does not represent democracy and there was no transparency. Furthermore, the people did not know what they voted for and they have the right to vote again, now they understand consequences. You must ask the people to vote again.

attributes.action: Disabled Facilities Grant should be available to everyone who is disabled
attributes.background: Disabled people can only qualify for a grant if they are on means-tested benefits or have an annual household income less then £16,000. If you are getting DLA or PIP and working tax credits you should be able to access the Disabled Facilities Grant.
attributes.additional_details: As a young disabled woman I have found it impossible to get a grant for wheelchair access adaptations to my home, all because I work part time and my parents work full time. The Government need to change the criteria for Disabled Facilities Grants.

attributes.action: Include Paediatric First Aid Training in the ante-natal classes for new parents
attributes.background: There have been many situations where trained parents have saved their babies life but there’s also one to many cases where a baby has been lost because parents were lost in despair not knowing to take action. Knowing CPR is critical and all new parents should know how to save the baby if needed be.
attributes.additional_details: Many parents have taken their sad stories to social media to warn other parents of potential risks and advised them to take a CPR course

attributes.action: Cancel Trump's proposed State Visit unless he publicly condemns Britain First.
attributes.background: President Trump has broadcast racist material produced by Britain First to his 43 million Twitter followers. This has rightly been condemned by the leaders of all mainstream UK parties, but I believe that does not go far enough to convey the strength of disgust felt across the spectrum of society.

attributes.action: Stop Proceeds of Crime Act powers from being used in planning cases
attributes.background: Change the law to stop local authorities using powers in the Proceeds of Crime Act in planning cases. The POCA was intended to be used to seize assets of drug dealers, arms dealers etc - serious criminals. Local authorities must be prevented from using it against people for breaching planning laws.
attributes.additional_details: My family are a farming family. Due to an alleged planning infraction and an enforcement order that escalated, the powers in the Proceeds of Crime Act can be used take assets that my family has worked for all of our lives. For our assets (up to and including the family home) to be called a 'proceed of crime' is unjust, immoral and deeply unfair.

attributes.action: Public Inquiry into the actions of South Yorkshire Police at Orgreave 1984
attributes.background: At Orgreave, South Yorkshire Police ordered officers to charge "a largely peaceful crowd" & evidence given by South Yorkshire Police (SYP) has been described as "the biggest frame-up ever", SYP had a culture of fabricating evidence, which was not corrected by the time of the Hillsborough disaster.

attributes.action: Abolition of the coarse fishing closed season on rivers (16th March-16th June)
attributes.background: This outdated law has left us Angler’s twiddling our thumbs for years, there is no evidence to prove all year round fishing harms fish’s breeding habits, no effects have been seen on commercial fisheries and canals which have had no closed season for years.
attributes.additional_details: We have also seen the loss of Tackle & bait shops for years during the closed season as takings reduce massively, fishing seems to be a dying hobby which is a crying shame as kids and adults alike could do with more outside pastimes not less. More fishing time and longer evenings (in closed season) can give the sport and local businesses a real boost and give more opportunities for people to take up Angling.

attributes.action: Scrap tuition fees for paramedic science and nursing degrees
attributes.background:
Tuition fees for students studying in England are £9250 a year regardless of the course being studied and the expected salary.
This means that students studying degrees such as nursing or paramedic science who will largely go into the NHS where salaries are capped are having to incur huge debts
attributes.additional_details:
Tuition fees were supposed to be a way of ensuring students who went on to earn higher salaries by virtue of their degree paid by the tax payer. Yet this now includes nurses and paramedics who have to have a degree rather than learning the skills on the job with time out for classroom based learning. 
They also have their salaries capped by the government and at the same time there are a shortage of nurses and paramedics who are essential to the smooth running of the NHS.

attributes.action: Guard those with health problems from malicious messages (epilepsy/ strobe GIFs)
attributes.background: People with health conditions have to take precaution in everyday life, however, if they are specifically targeted via social media or message then there is nothing place to protect them against this. We, the undersigned, call on the Houses of Parliament to review this and make necessary changes.
attributes.additional_details: On 5th February 2018, a person posted a Strobe GIF to an epilepsy group leaving several people ill and one in hospital. Her profile states that she is based in the UK. People in the UK have been to the police regarding this. The police have wanted to do something about this but current UK legislation does not cover this, it does not even fall under "malicious communication".

attributes.action: Mandatory for all hospital theatres to evacuate diathermy  tissue smoke plume.
attributes.background: Despite having risk assessments,some surgeons are reluctant to use smoke evacuation, which puts perioperative staff and patients at a risk of breathing in harmful diathermy tissue smoke.
attributes.additional_details:
Diathermy smoke called plaque, is also carcinogenic and mutagenic and even contains hydrogen cyanide.One gram of diathermy tissue is equal to smoking six (6) unfiltered cigarettes.

I want the government to make diathermy smoke evacuation a compulsory requirement rather than a recommendation.

http://ortoday.com/the-real-risks-surgical-smoke/

attributes.action: Add the topic of eating disorders to the national PSHE curriculum
attributes.background: In the UK, 1.6 million people suffer from an eating disorder. This is an issue that often affects students, especially teenagers from 14-25. We believe that is often not talked about so to raise awareness and break the stigma we want it to be added to the national PSHE curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
6.4% of Adults displayed evidence of having an eating disorder. 
Children as young as 6 have been known to have an eating disorder.
Being able to spot the symptoms in a friend or family member is extremely important and with growing numbers of eating disorders in the UK, it is essential to equip the youth with the right knowledge.

LEARN MORE: 
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/eating-disorders/
https://www.mind.org.uk/information-support/types-of-mental-health-problems/eating-problems/

attributes.action: People Aid - govt pays your share of overseas aid to the charity you choose
attributes.background: Imagine you decide each year which UK charity/ies should be paid £300 (your share of the overseas aid). It could be a UK charity supporting foreign aid as at present or you may feel it would be better spent at home e.g. on a hospice, the local secondary school, animal welfare, medical research, etc.
attributes.additional_details: The aid budget will be about £14 billion a year over the next 5 years and there are about 48 million people on the electoral register for local elections. That's £300 per person per year. There are about 170,000 UK charities supporting both UK and foreign good causes. Examples - 1000 supporters of a local hospice or school could direct £1.5m goes there over 5 years; or through your local church 100 people decide to commit to a medical facility eradicating AIDS in Africa - that's £30,000 per year

attributes.action: To have a public holiday on 21 October to be called Trafalgar Day.
attributes.background: To commemorate one of the greatest days in our history.  We should be proud of that victory in 1805.  It is long overdue.

attributes.action: Full funding for Aflibercept, Bevacizumab,Lapatinib,Eribulin, Everolimus
attributes.background: I have cancer and I believe that the drug Bevacizmab would help my treatment and it is not currently funded by the NHS.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of products containing unsustainably sourced palm oil in the UK
attributes.background: Global production of and demand for palm oil is increasing rapidly. But this is at the expense of tropical rain-forests which form critical habitats for many endangered species and a lifeline for some human communities. Palm oil can be found in many foods and other household items. We can all help.
attributes.additional_details: Did anyone see the Orangutan Diary on BBC 2? The destruction of this species as well as many others is well underway and their already declining population will decrease by a further 1/3 by 2020 unless action is taken. Thousands upon thousands of orangutans have been killed and the destruction of the rain-forests is increasing at an exponential rate. We cannot control what happens in these countries but we can refuse to accept palm oil sourced via an unsustainable method in the UK.

attributes.action: NHS to provide badges for chronically/long term ill people for public transport
attributes.background: Currently NHS doesn’t provide people with chronic illnesses such as endometriosis and long term illnesses which have an impact on the persons quality of life badges for public transport. People with these conditions are extremely poorly would struggle to stand if there were no seats.

attributes.action: Introduce more mental health services for adolescents aged 16-18
attributes.background: In today's society there's an increasing rise in mental health issues in young people, 70% of young people do not receive appropriate resources. Many of these young people will not be able to receive appropriate help and resources as they are lost in the net of being mid 16-18.
attributes.additional_details: There are organisations such as CAMHS, however it is becoming increasingly common that when you reach mid 16-18 years of age you are lost in a net, where the referral will take too long and you have to wait until you're 18 to receive more resources and help. 20% of adolescents will experience a mental health problem, this is constantly increasing with more and more pressures of today's society. Young people need the support of trained professionals, mental health should not be pushed aside and they have a right to appropriate resources and should not have to wait until being 18.

attributes.action: Veterinary surgeons from outside the UK sit the statutory MRCVS examinations.
attributes.background: Non EU veterinary surgeon have to sit the MRCVS examinations some of them from more medically advanced countries than the UK. EU vets don’t have to sit this exam, but should, it would standardise the level of competency in veterinary surgeons allowed to practice in the UK.

attributes.action: Force manufacturers to use recyclable packaging instead of taxing consumers
attributes.background: Yet another "tax" on consumers is being considered to deal with packaging waste (proposal to add 20p to cost of takeaway coffee), following the 5p levy on carrier bags.The problem lies with manufacturers and retailers who should be forced to develop and use completely recyclable packaging materials.
attributes.additional_details: Expecting consumers to pay for the cost of recycling packaging is unfair.  We have no say in what packaging is used by manufacturers and retailers and the amount of waste which is recycled varies from authority to authority.  In many shops in Germany, bins are provided at the checkouts for unwanted packaging.  Recycling is never going to increase if the onus is placed on consumers rather than manufacturers and retailers.

attributes.action: Increase the National Minimum Wage to £10 per hour.
attributes.background: The National Minimum wage in the UK needs an immediate increase to £10 per hour to provide an acceptable living standard for hardworking people. The government has re-branded NMW as 'Living Wage' and this is wrong as the Living Wage Foundation states it should be £8.75 for UK and £10.20 for London.
attributes.additional_details:
The cost of living is rising year on year and the nation needs to be rewarded for our hard work. £10 an hour isn't for holidays and lavish spending, it is to cover basic living costs. The UK economy would benefit from extra tax receipts and increased manufacturing output as people could spend more.
In a time when MP's earn £74,962 basic pay and claim expenses on top and a worker on Minimum Wage averages £13500 before tax and has to pay for work expenses is it too much to ask for £10 per hour?

attributes.action: To facilitate doctors entry into the Obs & Gyn training at ST3+ level
attributes.background: Non trainee doctors, contribute significantly to the provision of healthcare in the NHS. They are often overlooked when it comes to training opportunities, therefore unable to progress in their careers and are left disillusioned, frustrated and disappointed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently many specialities allow entry to the training at middle grade (ST3+level) except in speciality of Obstetrics and Gynaecology, which only allows entry at ST1 level.
Although there is a noticeable dropout rate of 40% of the trainees from ST1 level onwards, which impacts on the middle grade rota, as there is no recruitment for the trainees at this level, this has created significant difficulties in providing safe Obs and Gyn services. We request that the RCOG and Department of Health to create ST3+ level entry for training in Obs and Gyn . This will help to cover the middle grade rota gaps thus ensuring safe obstetric service in UK and allow  Non training grade doctors to fulfil their career ambitions. Overall, this will prevent the loss of highly skilled doctors from the NHS.

attributes.action: Make the locking of school toilets during class time illegal.
attributes.background: It is an awful process for teenage females who require access to the nearest toilet and for everyone who has medical conditions that require quick access to the toilet. Also, using the toilet is a necessary process. Requiring to find a teacher is not appropriate!
attributes.additional_details: Finding an appropriate member of staff with a key is a time-consuming process and isn't fast. Therefore under 'The Workplace (Health, Safety and Welfare) Regulations 1992' - Regulation 21 #188 - 'Sufficient toilet and washing facilities should be provided to allow everyone at work to use them without unreasonable delay.' [http://www.hse.gov.uk/pUbns/priced/l24.pdf] and Regulation 21 #190 in the same Act, 'Facilities should be located so they are convenient...' I believe locking school toilets fails to meet the criteria and these same rights should be applied to students. Having to find a member of staff, without knowing where they would be, takes time and I, with many others, argue that it is an 'unreasonable delay'!

attributes.action: Make Alzheimer’s/Dementia care completely funded by the NHS.
attributes.background:
Full funding for the care of Alzheimer’s and Dementia patients should be covered by the NHS. Plenty of families face so many worries when a loved one goes into care and paying for their care shouldn’t be one of them. 
Please take a moment to sign my petition.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Sign and Ratify the Treaty for the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons
attributes.background:
On 7 July 2017, 122 governments voted at the UN to adopt the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons. Nuclear weapons have now been categorically rejected by the international community.

“The world is over-armed and peace is under-funded …." United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon
attributes.additional_details:
The new Treaty puts nuclear weapons on the same legal footing as  biological weapons, chemical weapons, anti-personnel landmines and cluster munitions.

http://www.icanw.org/the-facts/catastrophic-harm/a-diversion-of-public-resources/

https://www.nuclearinfo.org/article/transport/foi-records-reveal-nuclear-warhead-convoy-safety-faults

http://www.icanw.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/WEBhumanitarianrisks.pdf

attributes.action: make wrongly reporting someone to a law enforcement agency a criminal offence
attributes.background: At present people who deliberately mislead the police by making false accusations may be prosecuted for a number of offences such as wasting police time or attempting to pervert the court of justice. There is no similar offence where malicious claims are made to other law enforcement agencies.
attributes.additional_details: There are regular prosecutions for wasting police time. Where a person acting maliciously reports his victim to the local authority, the RSPCA, trading standards, health and safety executive, the benefits agency, etc. the effects on the victim can be equally distressing, as well as costly in time and money for both the victim and the investigating agency. Civil redress would usually involve the High Court with a defamation action or similar and is beyond the means of many victims.

attributes.action: HM Ships Albion, Bulwark to be funded by the foreign aid budget.
attributes.background: UK defense cuts include removal of these ships and crews. This will result in loss of jobs and the UK being unable to respond to disasters such as recent events in the Caribbean and the Far East. They should be fully crewed and retained as part of the MOD resources paid via our foreign aid budget.
attributes.additional_details: These ships have the capability of transporting and helping rebuild Infrastructure around the world in conjunction with UK business. They should fly our flag and project UK businesses and innovations. This would also give valuable experience for our troops in wining hearts and minds. Assisting other Nations and would give a positive image of our Military. This would also show the tax paying public that our foreign aid budget is being used in a more positive way. It could also promote UK trade.

attributes.action: Make it statutory requirement for schools to consult parents about GCSE re-marks
attributes.background: Pupil failed GCSE by 1 mark. School said exam sent for re-mark. Without parent consultation, school only requested 1 component of exam be re-marked. We assumed whole exam was re-marked and would have requested this if had been asked. Extra mark not found & deadlines closed to get other paper marked.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are making decisions about GCSE re-marks without consulting parents as the JCQ Guidance does not state they must consult parents in decisions. In this case the School negligently sent a component for a re-mark that had met the grade boundary for a pass and did not send the component that needed 1 more mark for a pass despite this component being worth 60% of the mark. Exam board have confirmed that there were more marks on the unsent component. School should have sent both to find 1 mark

attributes.action: Ban the use of strobe lighting!
attributes.background: Epilepsy is a common condition but unfortunately very much overlooked. The use of strobe lighting at public events such as theaters, cinemas and even on t.v is restricting the ability of epileptic people to enjoy such luxuries. Strobe lighting is effecting peoples lives and it should be stopped!
attributes.additional_details: More and more things are introducing strobe lighting or flashing images  without warning and it's becoming a serious issue to myself and others health. Epilepsy is a serious condition and more people need to be aware of it, moreover, people who are hosting such events need to take into account that strobe lighting may effects certain members of the audience. After all there are other ways of making a scene look dramatic without the use of strobe or flashing lights.

attributes.action: To make it compulsory to make midwives check for CHD's in new baby home visits.
attributes.background:
My brother was born with an unknown CHD. My mum was unaware of any of this as no-one picked it up.
Now my brother has to have invasive surgeries all his life.
Many babies go home without knowing they  are very I'll. I want to change that please sign this so more babies beat these horrible diseases
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS do not disclose that they are looking for CHD's in 5 month scan, nor do they spefically look after birth.
This I think needs to be changed midwives should carry guidelines for this and oximeters to potiantally save a baby. 
Too many babies die from these illnesses.
I have seen this first hand.

attributes.action: Make the Treasury remove the VAT on fuel duty
attributes.background: If you buy fuel at £1.229 per litre, petrol or diesel, are you aware that 11.59 pence of the total VAT on the fuel you purchase is actually a tax upon the fuel duty, which is also a government tax on fuel!!!
attributes.additional_details: If the VAT on the fuel duty is removed, then the £1.229p cost of fuel will reduce to £1.02p!!!!

attributes.action: Stop the closure of Dagenham Jobcentre
attributes.background:
Dagenham Jobcentre is set to close on 19th January 2018, as part of a program of closures of Jobcentres across the country.
Dagenham residents will struggle to get to Barking Jobcentre.
Residents will risk having payments stopped through sanctions, being forced into debt and destitution.
attributes.additional_details:
Universal credit is too complicated particularly for vulnerable people such as those with mental health issues.
People struggling with the online access risk having their money stopped through sanctions.
Over one million low-paid workers will also be drawn into the new system and could face sanctions if they don’t prove they are applying for better paid work.
Residents in Dagenham NEED a jobcentre in order to be able to cope with the chaos caused by the implementation of Universal Credit.

attributes.action: Teach LGBTQ sexual education in schools and about other sexuality's.
attributes.background: Within schools teaching LGBTQ sexual education is not on the curriculum, leaving those who are homosexual without the correct education that they need to have healthy and positive sexual experiences, with many contracting diseases. The spectrum of sexuality's are also left open for stereotyping.
attributes.additional_details:
The GLSEN 2013 National School Climate Survey found that fewer than five percent of LGBT students had health classes that included positive representations of LGBTQ topics.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-33237995-for facts on sexually transmitted diseases for men

https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/a-to-z/s/sexuality-for how mental health affects those on the spectrum.

attributes.action: Make cat calling, objectification and sexual harassment in the street illegal.
attributes.background:
We need to introduce a zero tolerance policy against cat calling and sexual harassment in the streets. 

There is currently nowhere to report these incidents and no penalty if caught.

France has introduced a law against catcalling which should be replicated in the UK.

attributes.action: Make shared parental leave available to all working parents
attributes.background: Shared parental leave is currently available only to employees leaving out self-employed partners, or casual worker, zero hours contract workers, agency worker, etc. Child care is a key factor why some working parents are on precarious contract. They are struggling to balance work and family life.
attributes.additional_details: The ability to have a career and a family is crucial for working parents. However, the ability to achieve the balance between caring for the children and working can be very challenging without the right support in place. Parents have resorted to working part time, or go on precarious contracts to achieve this balance. Since they lack the employee status, they are not eligible for some of the family friendly rights such as shared parental leave. Parents should be supported to achieve this.

attributes.action: Increase paternity leave so it is 3 months off on full pay.
attributes.background:
I would like to propose a change to the law regarding paternity leave. I think that the current law is determinal to parents and should be altered to support working families.
I feel that fathers should get 3 months paternity leave at full pay, with an option of a further 3 months at part pay.
attributes.additional_details:
The changes would also include kit days.
Extended leave would benefit:
1. Mums recovery. The minimum recovery time for a c section is 6 weeks. If dads were off for the 3 month period they would be able to support. 
2. Sleep deprevation - babies sleep is irregular in the first 3 months. There is lots of research on sleep deprevation and its negative impact in the workplace. 
3. Dad bonding - research suggests children with good paternal bonds are often better off later in life.

attributes.action: Make the long term tethering of ponies illegal
attributes.background: There are many ponies tethered for days on end on grass verges,even roundabouts in towns such as Harlow, where there is little in the way of shelter from the excesses of weather,hot or cold and are often are deprived of water to drink.

attributes.action: Give PCV Cat D drivers Cat C (HGV) entitlement
attributes.background:
Currently there is a shortage of Cat C HGV drivers if Cat D entitled drivers were given Cat C status this would help close the shortfall. 
Cat D & C test are almost the same and the vehicles have the same characteristics in movement.

attributes.action: Give users of mobile phones while driving a 3 month driving ban.
attributes.background: Every day I walk my dogs I see many drivers using their mobile phones. Clearly the 6 points and £200 fine have not had the desired effect to make people stop using phones while driving.
attributes.additional_details: I firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive. Before I retired it would have been very difficult for me to get to work without my car as no public transport was available. If others were put in this position then it will make them think before using the phone, hopefully!

attributes.action: The creation of Sedentary Behaviour Guidelines for the Early Years.
attributes.background: In today’s world there are many trends emerging, which mean children are starting in school underdeveloped physically, emotionally and mentally. We are calling for the government to create a set of Sedentary Behaviour Guidelines for the Early Years (aged 0–4 years) to help combat this.
attributes.additional_details: These national guidelines are in response to a call from health and health care professionals, child care providers, and fitness practitioners for guidance on sedentary behaviour in the early years. There is a strong relationship between sedentary behaviour (predominantly screen time) and health indicators (healthy body weight, bone and skeletal health, motor skill development, psychosocial health, cognitive development, and cardio-metabolic disease risk factors).

attributes.action: Make it illegal for discrimination of those with non-offensive visible tattoos.
attributes.background: Times are changing, and we as a country have to change with them.  Many workplaces can and will choose to discriminate against those who have visible tattoos.  Non-discrimination is a cross-cutting principle in international human rights law.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 1 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights: “All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights".

Article 10 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights: "The right to communicate and express yourself in any medium, including words, pictures and actions".

Two of our Basic human rights that employers violate. Discrimination against Race, Gender, Age, Sexual Orientation & Disabilities have all been addressed, now we should address the discrimination of visible body art.

attributes.action: Ban balloon manufacture/sale and make mass balloon releases a criminal offence,
attributes.background: Balloons do not go to heaven, when they land the consequences are deadly for wildlife, 70% of the time they end up in oceans.  Animals often mistake them for  food, leading to stomach and intestinal blockages and eventual starvation.
attributes.additional_details:
https://balloonsblow.org/
https://www.ukrivers.net/balloon_fact.html

attributes.action: Increase the age limit to 25 to buy alcohol.
attributes.background: On February 15th 2018 my little brother lost his life aged only 27 years old. He was an alcoholic and fought ferociously to overcome his addiction. I work in retail and I have to challenge anyone who appears to be under 25. So why not just make it legal to be 25 or older??

attributes.action: Hold Referendum in Scotland, to end devolution and return control to Westminster
attributes.background: Due to the actions of the Scottish government, ruining Scotland's economy and creating severe division in the populace, there is an increasing opinion that the welfare of the Scottish people could be better served by the Westminster Government.

attributes.action: Reduce the price of British citizenship for children from £973 to less than £600
attributes.background: The price for British citizenship for children is currently £973, and without this they can't vote or claim student loans. The Home Office makes over £500 profit for each application and this makes many families unable to afford citizenship. The government are putting a price on democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
These children will, later in life, pay taxes as a normal citizen would, but will not benefit in the same way.

As well as this, over 3,000 children that do apply, are denied the citizenship and not refunded the £973 fee.

The right to these has been given to these children by parliament, but currently they are being sold by the home office.

To find out more about the issue, you can read this article:

https://www.vice.com/en_uk/article/534zx8/the-british-born-kids-who-cant-afford-to-be-british

attributes.action: Make it the law for all public places with toilets to have baby change table
attributes.background:
Visited a Subway Restaurant and was surprised to find no where available to change my babies nappy. So I had to change him on a sofa in the restaurant.
After some researching, I have found that public places legally DO NOT have to supply a baby change facility.
attributes.additional_details:
I think this is completely wrong. It's not appropriate to change a baby on a dirty toilet floor or in a public open space as you dont know whose around. This needs to change.
Please help get this law changed. So that all public toilets have to have a changing table available.
Thank you for you support
